Location, location, location. Situated just 12 miles east of Montrose and the MTJ airport, and exactly 1.5 hours from both Telluride and Crested Butte, the Gulch offers easy access to your home away from home. This turnkey western Colorado ranch has it all.    This amazing 1,760-acre ranch borders over 800 acres of BLM ground. With elevations ranging from 7,100 feet at the home site to 9,000 feet at the top, you feel like you are hunting on a much larger property. It boasts multiple types of mule deer and elk habitat, from pinion juniper, large oak brush patches and big sagebrush flats to pine and aspen at the top elevation.  A canal runs the entire width of the property and provides live water from spring through late fall. With the region's fantastic mule deer genetics, hunters have taken mule deer that score in the mid-190s B&C as well as elk and black bears annually.    The current owner has just completed miles of new roads and fencing, making this move-in ready property far more huntable. The improvements provide easy access to hunt the property from many different directions and access points.    The property's traditional 2,100 sq. foot. 3-bedroom, 2-bath all-log home with log trusses and hardwood floors was built to impress, offering natural warmth and comfort in a stress-free atmosphere. The owner just completed a major renovation of the house including all new furniture, creating a space ready for enjoyment and entertaining.    Main floor focal points include a living room with a stone gas fireplace topped with a wall-mounted big-screen TV and a kitchen with granite countertops, granite breakfast bar, gas stove and high-end appliances. Off the kitchen is the dining room and a butler's pantry/coffee bar, laundry room, bathroom and two bedrooms situated away from the common areas for utmost privacy. The upstairs is designed as a private master suite with a large bedroom, bathroom, sitting area and private deck.    A breezeway complete with skylights connects the home to the matching log garage. The walkway and patio are marked by concrete squares laid in diamond shapes. A mud room at the back of the home opens to the concrete patio with an iron firepit, grill, hot tub and seating area including custom Adirondack chairs and rockers and a log picnic table and benches. Venture about 100 yards from the main home down a private driveway to a one-bedroom, one-bath upscale bunk house offering two bunk beds with a kitchenette featuring a gas stove, refrigerator and even a built-in desk. The bunkhouse is perfect for extra guests or your hunting buddies that won't be staying at the main house and could be an ideal Air B&B.    The ranch is set up for horse lovers, hunters or anyone who just enjoys a beautiful outdoor setting. Included is a 3,000-sq. ft. barn/shop with a built-in loft hay loft or as a storage area adjoining large the horse corrals.    Enjoy the benefits of privacy while being so close to the beautiful town of Montrose, named one of Outdoor Life's Top 200 Towns for Outdoorsmen, offering incredible golf courses, museums and an amazing recreation center with ample shopping and dining options. The ranch is also only 8 miles from the famous Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park which known for its deep canyon and some of the best Gold Medal water in the state for trout fishing.  The Blue Mesa Reservoir, Colorado's largest reservoir, is only 30 miles away and offers great trout and kokanee salmon fishing and holds the state lake trout record at over 50 pounds. Just 45 minutes away is the Ridgway Reservoir, which has great browns and some smallmouth bass. Welcome to the Valley Springs Ranch! A very unique sporting retreat along the banks of the Gunnison River. 250 acres of prime hunting and fishing habitat with 0.9 miles of Gunnison River frontage, approximately 1.5 miles of Tongue Creek frontage, several springs, and water rights. Conveniently located just northeast of the town of Delta Colorado near the base of the Grand Mesa, the ranch enjoys year-round county maintained access via Highway 65. Towering cottonwoods line the river and stream banks and surround numerous grassy meadows and riparian areas. Views of the West Elk and San Juan mountain ranges can be seen from several locations on the ranch, as well as the Uncompahgre Plateau and the Grand Mesa. Great mule deer, turkey, quail, grouse, and waterfowl hunting and viewing opportunities abound on the ranch. There are also several Blue Heron nesting areas on the ranch, as well as good habitat for potential upland bird hunting opportunities. In fact, the western portion of the ranch once served as a private duck hunting club back in the day. The ranch qualifies for enrollment into the Landowner Preference Program, which could provide coveted mule deer buck hunting tags for those so inclined to harvest some of the high quality bucks that reside here. This stretch of the Gunnison River offers fantastic brown and rainbow trout fishing opportunities, as well as river rafting, right in your own back yard! The ranch is currently being utilized as a private sporting retreat and for cattle grazing. There is a charming 3,596 square foot main home, a 1900 historic 1,352 square foot guest house, and a 40' x 72.5' insulated shop. The main floor of the main home contains two bedrooms, one full bath, one 3/4 bath, an open kitchen and dining area with new appliances, a living room, and a sun room. The basement of the main home is partially finished with great storage space and contains two non conforming bedrooms, one 3/4 bath, and a wood stove. These two bedrooms could become conforming if the windows were enlarged to meet the county standard. The 1900 historic guest house is currently under renovation at the drywall stage, and could be custom finished to accommodate a new owner. There are incredible conservation resources on the ranch, which is why 122 acres are currently conserved by the Colorado West Land Trust. There is a beautiful location in the central portion of the ranch near the river where one could potentially build a new home, cabins or a lodge. Whether you are looking for a private sporting retreat, a potential event venue, vacation rental income, or you simply want to build your dream home in a beautiful setting close to town, the Valley Springs Ranch checks a lot of boxes!
